news_header: Japan is restarting its second nuclear reactor at the Onagawa power plant after the 2011 Fukushima disaster.
news_text: Following the 2011 Fukushima disaster, Japan shut down all 54 nuclear reactors but has since restarted 12 out of 33 units. The second reactor at the Onagawa nuclear power plant in Miyagi Prefecture is set to be restarted, featuring enhanced safety measures, including a protective wall against tsunamis. This marks the first restart of a reactor similar to those affected by the Fukushima incident.
